thread.title: Class D playoff preview: Deposit/Hancock vs. Groton
thread.title_full: Class D playoff preview: Deposit/Hancock vs. Groton

title: Class D playoff preview: Deposit/Hancock vs. Groton
text:
Class D playoff preview: Deposit/Hancock vs. Groton 
By wbng sports October 21, 2015 Updated Oct 21, 2015 at 12:01 AM EDT 
(WBNG Binghamton) Deposit/Hancock is the only Class D team in Section IV that is still undefeated, but because of the points system the Eagles only got the second seed in this year's playoffs. 
But they certainly haven't played that way. 
WBNG E-News - Sign Up For Our Newsletter! 
Deposit/Hancock is scoring 40 points a game and the Eagles have impressive wins over Walton and Greene. 
Seventh seed Groton, Deposit/Hancock's opponent this week in the quarterfinals, sneaked into the playoffs by winning three of their final four games to finish 3-1 in their division and 4-3 overall. 
The Indians can also score, averaging 35 points a game so far this season. 
This game is set for Friday night at Hancock at 7 p.m. To submit a comment on this article, your email address is required. We respect your privacy and your email will not be visible to others nor will it be added to any email lists. Most Viewed
